# PyShala

> A self-hosted interactive Python training platform with live code execution, automated testing, and quiz lessons.

PyShala is a web application for creating and delivering Python programming courses. It provides an interactive learning environment where students can write code, run it against test cases, and take quizzes.

## Installation

```bash
pip install pyshala
```

## Quick Start

```bash
# Run with built-in sample lessons
pyshala

# Run with custom lessons
pyshala --lessons /path/to/lessons
```

## Core Features

- Live Python code execution in the browser
- Monaco code editor with syntax highlighting
- Automated test case validation
- Quiz lessons with MCQ and text questions
- YAML-based lesson configuration
- Dark/light theme support
- Session-based progress tracking

## Lesson Types

### Code Lessons

Interactive coding exercises with test cases:

```yaml
title: "Hello World"
instructions: |
  Write a program that prints "Hello, World!"
starter_code: |
  # Your code here
test_cases:
  - description: "Prints greeting"
    expected_output: "Hello, World!"
```

### Quiz Lessons

Knowledge assessments with MCQ and text questions:

```yaml
title: "Python Quiz"
type: "quiz"
questions:
  - id: "q1"
    type: "mcq"
    text: "What function prints output?"
    options:
      - id: "a"
        text: "print()"
      - id: "b"
        text: "echo()"
    correct: ["a"]
  - id: "q2"
    type: "text"
    text: "What is 2 + 2?"
    correct: ["4"]
```

## Directory Structure

```
lessons/
├── config.yaml           # App configuration
├── module_name/          # Module folder
│   ├── module.yaml       # Module metadata
│   ├── 01_lesson.yaml    # Code lesson
│   └── 02_quiz.yaml      # Quiz lesson
```

## App Configuration

```yaml
# config.yaml
title: "My Python Course"
subtitle: "Learn Python Today"
description: "Interactive Python lessons"
about_url: "https://example.com"
about_text: "About"
icon: "book-open"
```

## Module Configuration

```yaml
# module.yaml
name: "Python Basics"
description: "Learn Python fundamentals"
order: 1
lessons:
  - 01_hello.yaml
  - 02_variables.yaml
  - 03_quiz.yaml
```

## Test Case Format

```yaml
test_cases:
  - description: "Test description"
    stdin: "input"           # Optional input
    expected_output: "output"
    hidden: false            # Optional, hide from student
```

## Question Format

### MCQ (Multiple Choice)

```yaml
- id: "q1"
  type: "mcq"
  text: "Question text"
  multi_select: false  # true for checkboxes
  options:
    - id: "a"
      text: "Option A"
    - id: "b"
      text: "Option B"
  correct: ["a"]
```

### Text Question

```yaml
- id: "q2"
  type: "text"
  text: "Question text"
  correct: ["answer1", "answer2"]  # Case-insensitive matching
```

## CLI Options

| Option | Default | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| --lessons | Built-in | Lessons directory path |
| --port | 3000 | Frontend port |
| --backend-port | 8000 | Backend port |
| --host | 0.0.0.0 | Host address |

## Python API

```python
from pyshala import run_app

run_app(
    lessons_path="/path/to/lessons",
    port=3000,
    backend_port=8000,
)
```

## Environment Variables

| Variable | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| LESSONS_PATH | Path to lessons directory |
| PYSHALA_CONFIG | Path to config.yaml |

## Docker

```bash
docker run -p 3000:3000 -v /lessons:/lessons pyshala
```
